notes: Confirmed: libSkiaSharp.dll has a hard link-time import of d3d12.dll and D3DCOMPILER_47.dll starting from SkiaSharp 3.119.0. No delay-load is configured. On Windows systems without DX12 support, the DLL loader will fail before any SkiaSharp code executes. Version discrepancy: the reporter stated 3.116.0, but PE import analysis shows 3.116.0 does NOT have the d3d12 dependency — it was introduced in 3.119.0. The bug is real and affects the latest stable release (3.119.2) and main branch. The build config (native/windows/build.cake) defaults SUPPORT_DIRECT3D to true, and CheckWindowsDependencies only excludes VCRUNTIME/MSVCP, so d3d12 is not flagged.

reproductionSteps.description: Download SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.Win32 NuGet packages for versions 2.88.9, 3.116.0, 3.119.0, and 3.119.2 to inspect their Windows native DLLs
reproductionSteps.output: Downloaded and extracted win-x64 native DLLs for all versions.

reproductionSteps.command: python3 -c "import pefile; pe=pefile.PE('nupkg-3116/runtimes/win-x64/native/libSkiaSharp.dll'); [print(e.dll.decode()) for e in pe.DIRECTORY_ENTRY_IMPORT]"

KERNEL32.dll
USER32.dll
ole32.dll

No d3d12.dll or D3DCOMPILER_47.dll in import table.

reproductionSteps.command: python3 -c "import pefile; pe=pefile.PE('nupkg-2889/runtimes/win-x64/native/libSkiaSharp.dll'); [print(e.dll.decode()) for e in pe.DIRECTORY_ENTRY_IMPORT]"
reproductionSteps.output:

KERNEL32.dll

No d3d12.dll — confirmed safe.

reproductionSteps.description: Inspect PE import table of libSkiaSharp.dll from SkiaSharp 3.119.0 for d3d12.dll dependency — this is the version referenced by related issue #3267
reproductionSteps.command: python3 -c "import pefile; pe=pefile.PE('nupkg-3119/runtimes/win-x64/native/libSkiaSharp.dll'); [print(e.dll.decode()) for e in pe.DIRECTORY_ENTRY_IMPORT]"
reproductionSteps.output:
ole32.dll
FONTSUB.dll
USER32.dll
d3d12.dll
D3DCOMPILER_47.dll
KERNEL32.dll

d3d12.dll and D3DCOMPILER_47.dll FOUND in import table — hard link-time dependency confirmed.

filesCreated.description: Python script using pefile to parse PE import tables of libSkiaSharp.dll across versions
filesCreated.content:
import pefile

for ver, path in [("2.88.9", "nupkg-2889/runtimes/win-x64/native/libSkiaSharp.dll"),
                  ("3.116.0", "nupkg-3116/runtimes/win-x64/native/libSkiaSharp.dll"),
                  ("3.119.0", "nupkg-3119/runtimes/win-x64/native/libSkiaSharp.dll"),
                  ("3.119.2", "nupkg-31192/runtimes/win-x64/native/libSkiaSharp.dll")]:
    pe = pefile.PE(path)
    d3d = [e.dll.decode() for e in pe.DIRECTORY_ENTRY_IMPORT if 'd3d' in e.dll.decode().lower()]
    print(f"{ver}: {d3d if d3d else 'No D3D imports'}")
    pe.close()

errorMessages.primaryError: libSkiaSharp.dll has hard PE import table entries for d3d12.dll and D3DCOMPILER_47.dll — Windows DLL loader fails on systems without DX12 before any SkiaSharp code executes
additionalErrors: No /DELAYLOAD configured in build — d3d12.dll is loaded at DLL load time, not at first use
CheckWindowsDependencies in build only excludes VCRUNTIME/MSVCP — d3d12 is not flagged as problematic

triageCorrections.upstream: Triage stated 3.116.0 as the affected version based on reporter's claim
triageCorrections.corrected: PE import analysis shows 3.116.0 does NOT have d3d12.dll dependency. The dependency was introduced in 3.119.0. Reporter may have been on a different version or experienced a different root cause.

proposedResponse.body:
Thanks for reporting this! We've confirmed the core issue — `libSkiaSharp.dll` has a hard link-time import dependency on `d3d12.dll` and `D3DCOMPILER_47.dll` that causes the Windows DLL loader to fail on systems without DX12 support.

**PE import table analysis across versions:**

| Version | d3d12.dll import | D3DCOMPILER_47.dll import |
|---------|:---:|:---:|
| 2.88.9 | ❌ | ❌ |
| 3.116.0 | ❌ | ❌ |
| 3.116.1 | ❌ | ❌ |
| 3.118.0-preview.2.3 | ❌ | ❌ |
| 3.119.0 | ✅ | ✅ |
| 3.119.2 (latest) | ✅ | ✅ |
| main (source) | ✅ | ✅ |

**Note:** The dependency was introduced in **3.119.0**, not 3.116.0. The build configuration (`native/windows/build.cake`) defaults `SUPPORT_DIRECT3D` to `true` and links `d3d12.lib` directly without `/DELAYLOAD`. The post-build `CheckWindowsDependencies` only flags `VCRUNTIME`/`MSVCP` as prohibited imports.

**Root cause:** `skia_use_direct3d=true` in the GN build args causes Skia's `BUILD.gn` to link `d3d12.lib` and `d3dcompiler.lib` statically, creating hard PE import entries.

**Workarounds:**
- Downgrade to SkiaSharp 3.116.1 or earlier (no d3d12 dependency)
- Build from source with `SUPPORT_DIRECT3D=false`

This is the same root cause as #3267.
proposedResponse.summary: Confirmed d3d12.dll hard dependency in 3.119.0+; not present in 3.116.0 as reported

actionability.reason: d3d12.dll hard import confirmed in 3.119.0, 3.119.2 (latest), and main branch. No fix exists — build still defaults SUPPORT_DIRECT3D=true with no delay-load. Affects any Windows system without DX12 support.

workarounds: Downgrade to SkiaSharp 3.116.1 or earlier which does not have the d3d12.dll dependency
Build SkiaSharp from source with SUPPORT_DIRECT3D=false to eliminate the dependency entirely

actions.description: Add tenet/compatibility label — this is a compatibility regression affecting systems without DX12
Mark as duplicate of #3267 — same root cause (d3d12.dll hard dependency)
Cross-reference #3300 — same issue on Windows Server 2012 R2
